title: Piz Gannaretsch
text:
Piz Gannaretsch is a <a href="mountain">mountain</a> in the <a href="Lepontine%20Alps">Lepontine Alps</a>, overlooking <a href="Sedrun">Sedrun</a> in <a href="Graub%C3%BCnden">Graubünden</a>. At 3,040 metres above sea level, its summit is the highest point of the range lying between <a href="St%20Gotthard%20Pass">St Gotthard Pass</a> and <a href="Lukmanier%20Pass">Lukmanier Pass</a>. The massif of Piz Gannaretsch separates the valleys of <a href="Lake%20Nalps">Lake Nalps</a> (west) and <a href="Lake%20Sontga%20Maria">Lake Sontga Maria</a> (east).
A glacier named "Glatscher da Gannaretsch" lies over the north-western flanks of Piz Gannaretsch.
